Kerry's war record or his plan for Iraq and the economy?

 this is exactly where it started to go downhill: from the very onset. something as inconsequential and totally irrelevant as kerry's accomplishments 35 years ago. people who supported kerry based on his war record are obliviuos to the issues. people who attacked kerry's character based on his war record are oblivious to te issues. the thing is, kerry brought this upon himself. a true politician, playing by the rules

What's more important?

 
 What's more important? The real question. The only question.
 
 I'm a non-conservative. Go ahead. Call me a liberal. It's not a dirty word. That's the title I have to wear as a moderate person who takes each issue as a stand alone and then weighs them, looks at the big picture and decides what's most important.
 
 GWB's only claim to fame is that he's managed to coral multiple sub-cultures - some of whom don't even like each other.
 
 So let's define the issues. At least there will be half a dozen of us who decided with clear heads.
 
 To the pro-lifers: That ship has sailed. There's no going back. Even if abortion became illegal, I submit that the morning after pill would become a street drug sold in high schools like marijuana - or simply bought on the internet. That's reality in this millenium. No longer a deciding issue.
 
 To the Reagonomicists: At least economic policies is a valid debate. Let the best man win at the polls. I don't blame anybody who chooses their candidate based on this issue.
 
 To the anti-terrorist crowd: We're all anti-terrorist. It's just that some of us aren't quite as terrorized as others. The war on terrorism will go on - no matter what. The war in Iraq will too. Since the polls ask about the war on terrorism and the war in Iraq separately, and the results are quite different, I'd like to hear both candidates speak more about the war on terrorism. Let's not separate the 2 wars or lump them together depending entirely on the point that's being made. Iraq and terrorism are different. We got Saddam. So what. They still x-rayed my luggage last week. Catching OBL won't be the answer either. Terrorism would be a valid voting issue IF it were actually an issue.
 
 Iraq supporters: There aren't any. They're only anti-terrorists in disguise.

 as far as a voting issue, which candidate made the war on terror an issue? both bush or kerry will sustain control of iraq if given the chance, but what about terror? what about fighting terrorists? which party even mentioned that?
